title: Trump Moves to End Gender-Related Care for Minors, Threatening Hospitals That Offer It
summary: Proposed new rules would punish the hospitals by pulling all federal financing.  Advocates say lawsuits will follow.

title: Once Again, Health Care Proves to Be a Bitter Political Pill for G.O.P.
summary: The inability to find a credible counter to the Affordable Care Act has long bedeviled Republicans and cost them at the polls. It’s threatening to do so again next year.

title: Trump Administration Tries to Stop Some Immigrants From Driving Trucks
summary: The transportation department said the new rules were intended to make roads safer, but there’s no data to suggest that immigrants cause more truck accidents.

title: U.S. Inflation Slowed to 2.7% in November as Shutdown Distorts Data
summary: Data collection issues skewed the latest Consumer Price Index report, economists warned, clouding the picture for the Federal Reserve as it also grapples with a cooling labor market.

title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s Address to the Nation
summary: In an 18-minute address, President Trump said the economy was booming despite the public’s consistent concerns about prices. Here are six takeaways from the speech.

title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Prime-Time Address on the Economy
summary: The president cited misleading statistics to insist, wrongly, that prices were coming down.

title: ‘Don’s Best Friend’: How Epstein and Trump Bonded Over the Pursuit of Women
summary: The president has tried to minimize their friendship, but documents and interviews reveal an intense and complicated relationship. Chasing women was a game of ego and dominance. Female bodies were currency.

title: Shock and Sadness Hang Over the Reiners’ Neighborhood
summary: Neighbors said a pall had fallen over the wealthy Los Angeles area where Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, were found stabbed to death.

title: Rob Reiner Family Tragedy Strikes a Nerve for Families Fighting Addiction
summary: Nick Reiner, charged with murdering his parents, Rob and Michele Singer Reiner, spent much of his life battling drug addiction, an affliction that millions of Americans face.

title: The Woman in the Coldplay Concert Kiss Cam Video Is Ready to Talk
summary: Kristin Cabot was caught on camera with her boss at a concert. The video went viral. Soon she was drowning in the vitriol of strangers.

title: Trump Media to Merge With TAE Technologies, a Nuclear Fusion Firm, in a $6 Billion Deal
summary: Trump Media & Technology Group, the social media and crypto company part owned by President Trump, said it would help develop a “utility-scale fusion power plant.”

title: The D.N.C. Is Scrapping Its Report on What Went Wrong in 2024
summary: Ken Martin, the Democratic National Committee chairman, ordered the autopsy months ago but is now said to believe that its release would be counterproductive for the party.

title: Pope Leo Appoints Bishop Ronald Hicks to Succeed Timothy Dolan
summary: The appointment of Bishop Ronald A. Hicks is expected to bring a markedly different leadership style to New York’s archdiocese.

title: The Putin Confidant Who Pushed Back Against Russia’s War in Ukraine
summary: Dmitri N. Kozak had worked with President Vladimir V. Putin for three decades before quitting in September. His associates described his break with the Russian leader.

title: Zelensky Appeals to E.U. Leaders for Frozen Russian Funds to Fight War
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky said in Brussels, where the leaders had gathered, that without the money, his country would have to reduce its drone production significantly.

title: Palo Alto Confronts Billionaires Over Their Housing Compounds
summary: The Silicon Valley college town has changed drastically as Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Page and other tech founders have scooped up multiple properties.

title: Sleep Cots and Graham Crackers at Elon Musk’s Child Care Program
summary: Mr. Musk has ambitions to remake education, but his latest effort to open an elementary school in Texas appears to have faltered.

title: New York City Set to Raise the Cap on Permits for Street Vendors
summary: The legislation, which would make thousands more permits available, is part of a package of City Council bills aimed at helping the city’s vendors get on the right side of the law.

title: They Thought They Had ‘Made It.’ Now They Can’t Afford Food.
summary: New Yorkers in the so-called “missing middle,” who may make too much for food benefits, say it’s still hard to find enough money for groceries.

title: City Council Introduces Bill to Create Mamdani’s Community Safety Agency
summary: The proposed Department of Community Safety would send mental health teams to respond to 911 calls, rather than the police, according to Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s plans.

title: Mamdani Names Budget Director as He Prepares to Enact Costly Agenda
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani chose Sherif Soliman, a veteran of municipal government and the chief financial officer of the City University of New York, to lead the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Iran’s President Says He Can’t Make ‘Miracles’ to Solve the Country’s Woes
summary: Despite sky-high inflation, water and energy cuts and prospects for a deal with the U. S. dimming, President Masoud Pezeshkian has apparently thrown up his hands.

title: David Brooks, E.J. Dionne and Robert Siegel Take Stock of 2025
summary: Trump is giving himself an A-plus-plus-plus, but the rest of America is anxious.

title: Wyoming Cowboys Are Breaking Down Barriers, Literally
summary: GPS collars on cattle are letting ranchers remove fences in the West. That’s good for wildlife and for the land.

title: French Doctor Sentenced to Life for Fatally Poisoning 12 People
summary: Frédéric Péchier, an anesthesiologist, was found guilty of poisoning 30 patients, of whom 12 died.

title: Is Applying to College Via Early Decision a Good Idea? Here’s What Your Income Has to Do With It.
summary: Early decision isn’t just for the rich, as long as people with lower incomes can get accurate price quotes before agreeing to attend if they get in.

title: Over 1,000 Were Killed in Attack on Camp in Darfur, Sudan, U.N. Says
summary: A paramilitary attack in April was one of the most brutal of Sudan’s civil war. Now, hunger is spreading as Western aid cuts have reduced U.N. rations.
